summary: Based on the provided documents, there is no mention of Charles Thone. The documents primarily concern the Assassination Records Review Board's (ARRB) final determination notifications regarding the release of HSCA (House Select Committee on Assassinations) staff payroll records. These notifications often involve the postponement of Social Security numbers to protect personal privacy. The documents also include payroll records, personnel records, and background checks related to HSCA staff and applicants. The absence of Charles Thone's name suggests he is not directly mentioned or involved in the specific records and notifications described in these documents.
significance: Without any mention in the provided documents, the significance of Charles Thone in the JFK assassination context cannot be determined.
